trans-unit.source: One of the user authorization properties.

seg-source.mrk: One of the user authorization properties.

target.mrk: One of the user authorization properties.

trans-unit.source: Enables the SQL standard authorization mode for the database or system on which this property is set. The possible values are:

seg-source.mrk: Enables the SQL standard authorization mode for the database or system on which this property is set.

target.mrk: Enables the SQL standard authorization mode for the database or system on which this property is set.

trans-unit.source: SQL authorization for the database or system is enabled, which allows the use of GRANT and REVOKE statements.

seg-source.mrk: SQL authorization for the database or system is enabled, which allows the use of GRANT and REVOKE statements.

target.mrk: SQL authorization for the database or system is enabled, which allows the use of GRANT and REVOKE statements.

trans-unit.source: SQL authorization for the database or system is disabled. After this property is set to TRUE, the property cannot be set back to FALSE.

seg-source.mrk: SQL authorization for the database or system is disabled.
After this property is set to TRUE, the property cannot be set back to FALSE.

target.mrk: SQL authorization for the database or system is disabled.
After this property is set to TRUE, the property cannot be set back to FALSE.

trans-unit.source: If you set this property as a system property before you create the databases, all new databases will automatically have SQL authorization enabled. If the databases already exist, you can set this property only as a database property.

seg-source.mrk: If you set this property as a system property before you create the databases, all new databases will automatically have SQL authorization enabled.
If the databases already exist, you can set this property only as a database property.

target.mrk: If you set this property as a system property before you create the databases, all new databases will automatically have SQL authorization enabled.
If the databases already exist, you can set this property only as a database property.

trans-unit.source: uses the type of user authentication that is specified with the derby.authentication.provider property.

seg-source.mrk: uses the type of user authentication that is specified with the derby.authentication.provider property.

target.mrk: uses the type of user authentication that is specified with the derby.authentication.provider property.

trans-unit.source: If the derby.authentication.provider property specifies NATIVE authentication, behaves as if derby.database.sqlAuthorization were set to TRUE, regardless of how derby.database.sqlAuthorization has been set by other means.

seg-source.mrk: If the derby.authentication.provider property specifies NATIVE authentication, behaves as if derby.database.sqlAuthorization were set to TRUE, regardless of how derby.database.sqlAuthorization has been set by other means.

target.mrk: If the derby.authentication.provider property specifies NATIVE authentication, behaves as if derby.database.sqlAuthorization were set to TRUE, regardless of how derby.database.sqlAuthorization has been set by other means.

trans-unit.source: For more information about user authorization, see "User authorizations" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: For more information about user authorization, see "User authorizations" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

target.mrk: For more information about user authorization, see "User authorizations" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: This property is static; if you change it while <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> is running, the change does not take effect until you reboot.

seg-source.mrk: This property is static; if you change it while <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> is running, the change does not take effect until you reboot.

target.mrk: This property is static; if you change it while <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> is running, the change does not take effect until you reboot.
